metadata.title: CVE-2015-7181 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The sec_asn1d_parse_leaf function in Mozilla Network Security Services(NSS) before 3.19.2.1 and 3.20.x before 3.20.1, as used in Firefox before42.0 and Firefox ESR 38.x before 38.4 and other products, improperlyrestricts access to an unspecified data structure, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possiblyexecute arbitrary code via crafted OCTET STRING data, related to a"use-after-poison" issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7181` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.19.2.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-1d - 2:3.19.2.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.19.2.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.19.2.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required
